item.title: Elections | Campaign advances for the last days to the “Mpop” style
item.description:
The elections for the Legislative Assembly are scheduled for the 14th, so the election campaign is almost over. In a report by Lusa agency, there are details of the “MPOP” style of the election campaign, with a lot of music and requests for financial support to the mixture
Crowded audience, all dressed in the gowns on the list with which they compete for the elections on the 14th; Chinese drums next to the stage and above candidates and supporters, various microphones, music and choreography. This is the campaign for Macao legislatures, in a style that can be called "MPOP". The microphones change hands, reproducing the same slogans with different voices, in short and acute scales, which end almost all in a party instruction. At this point, the drums are listened to loudly and the audience reproduces the last note heard, while shaking the political 'merchandising' that is handed over to the start of the rally: plastic hands to clap, numbers on the list with led lights, malleable straws, fans, all with the same color. Campaign actions in Macao, restricted to the last two weeks before legislative elections for the local parliament, do not contain speeches in the events of the six lists that will elect 14 of the 33 deputies to the Legislative Assembly (AL). The remaining 12 candidates are chosen through the associations, through the indirect suffrage, and there are still seven deputies appointed by the Chief Executive, in this case Sam Hou Fai. Describing campaign events is like an exercise of musical shows, namely the genus "Kpop", among the lists led by younger candidates, or the genre "pop old-myle", as if it was figures like Elvis or Olivia Newton John Risen. The concentrations are made up of the members of the lists and the people mobilized by them, some and the other dresses with the same uniforms. But there are no politicians on stage and viewers listening to them. In these events, politicians seem to be assumed as artists, but there are no audiences, because they seem to be part of the choreography. Finally, there are very few people besides and each other, that is, people watching who are not directly linked to the lists. Abstention is the great ghost that hangs over the whole process, which takes place for the first time under the framework of the new Electoral Law of April 2024, which aims to "reinforce the implementation of the" Macao Macao governed by Patriotas "principle. Economic challenges Ilia Chou, 40, an employee of the financial sector, was with a child and a friend watching one of these rallies and seemed to be one of those few people present not involved in the campaign list. He agreed to talk to Lusa after he had spoken to another microphone. Ilia was attracted to the list that was there because those people have a "young and community aspect" and are concerned with "offering prospects for progress" to young people. "Given the current challenging economic climate, we face a critical question: our young people now have fewer options than before. This specific aspect is what attracts me most in this initiative," he said. But “other groups also talk about youth and employment, what are the differences? Why do you like this particular group?” We asked. "I don't know them [the other groups]. Well, I was attracted to the charming characters of this list," he replied. "I think these four characters quite charming," Ilia added, they talk about "love, the title is very charming, and the color is pink, it looks very welcoming." Political programs are, without exception, lists of requests to an “provider father”, incarnated by the executive, who has the responsibility of managing a comfortable and growing financial reserve, fueled by taxes paid by the six game dealers in Macao. The numbers show this comfort. In August, the Macao Financial Reserve, which was always growing throughout the first half, reached 647.3 billion patacas, and was applied in subcontracted investments, deposits, current accounts, and credit securities. Lists want to be applied to initiatives such as the creation of a development fund and the reversal of 10 percent profits for distribution by all citizens, want to increase pensions or more money in consumer coupons, subsidies and maternity licenses, want more social housing, want free health and higher education, or simply require greater annual money distribution. Masses for the masses There are also other demands, such as promoting the diversification of the economy, measures to support the transformation and modernization of small and medium enterprises or intelligent city development, but the most significant part of the six lists programs points directly to the distribution of money from the government in the most varied forms. The other recipients of the requests are the game dealers, to which the candidates go with warnings that they are determined to defend the priority of residents in access to the best paid jobs. Macao's unemployment rate is 2 percent and permanent residents at 2.6 percent. That is, technically, Macau has full employment. However, as Lusa told a candidate, the employment issue has nothing to do with statistics, it just holds on with "perception." And in fact the question of unemployment, especially those who have just graduated, is a pressing issue of political programs, as HM indicated. This is the case of the first list to compete for direct suffrage, the “Association of United Citizens of Macao”, which is led by Song Pek Kei, a deputy linked to the Fujian community, who took the first steps in politics alongside businessman Chan Meng Kam. The list led by the deputy asks, for example, the creation of a share for residents in all professional areas, “support for employment and local companies”, and the guarantee that “85 percent, or more, employees are local residents”. The Nova Esperança list, led by José Pereira Coutinho, and one of the few macanese participants in these elections, asks for “employment for all”, a slogan present in his electoral program where the “employment priority for Macao's permanent residents is promised at game dealers”. Who goes out to their List campaigns for indirect suffrage may seem more discreet, but that doesn't mean there is no news. After investing in Global Media, Portugal, and betting on the real estate area, in Porto, Kevin Ho, the nephew of the first chief executive, Edmund Ho, bet on local politics, when entering the list “Union of Macao Business Interests”, led by José Chui Sa Peng. Also he is familiar, in this case, from a previous head of the Executive of MSAR, Chui Sai On, already removed from the political scene. In the case of these lists, representative of the sectors of labor, culture, education or business interests, employment is a concern, but what the candidates are looking for is a government that can support companies and finally diversify the economy. Thus, in the “union of business interests of Macao”, it is advocated “support for digital and high technology transformation to modernize traditional industries and develop emerging sectors”. Candidates promise to play the role of intermediaries between those who have difficulty maintaining in this business fabric and the executive by “listening carefully to the difficulties and claims of the commercial and financial industries, especially small and medium enterprises”. The names of the seven appointed deputies are not yet known, as the Chief Executive's choice is usually made public only after the elections. A.S.S. / Portuguese

item.title: Finance | Portugal withdraws Hong Kong from the list of tax havens
item.description:
From January 1, 2026, Hong Kong will no longer be part of the Portuguese tax paradise list, such as Liechtenstein and Uruguay. The authorities in the neighboring region have long called for the withdrawal, including official visits to Portugal. The Portugal-Hong Chamber of Commerce and Industry Kong emphasizes the decision consistent with the position of the European Union
The Hong Kong government has finally seen the desire, expressed several times, to leave the list of tax havens in Portugal. The change will be a reality from January 1, 2026, taking into account the ordinance published on Friday by the Ministry of Finance in the Diário da República. According to this document, Hong Kong is no longer included in the list of “clearly more favorable tax regimes”, the official name of the list commonly known as the “Fiscal Paradise List”. It reads at the Ordinance, signed by the Secretary of State for Tax Affairs, Claudia Reis Duarte, that “the governments of the Special Administrative Region of Hong Kong, the Principality of Liechtenstein and the East Republic of Uruguay drove formal requests” to the “revision of their framing in the list, which were the subject of positive opinions elaborated by the Tax and Customs Authority”. The withdrawal of these three countries and territories is officially on January 1 of next year. Thus, the Portuguese Government considers that the conditions are verified to, in the legally established terms, exclude those jurisdictions from the list of countries, territories or regions with clearly more favorable tax regimes ”. It is also noteworthy that “the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, the Principality of Liechtenstein and the Eastern Republic of Uruguay are not on the European Union of Non-Cooperative Jurisdiction List, adopted by the European Union Council, which took place on February 18, 2025”. It is recalled that one of the last times that Hong Kong made a formal request to leave the list of tax havens was during the visit to Lisbon of the Secretary for Financial and Treasury Services, Christopher Hui Ching-Yu, last year, as a meeting with Secretary of State Claudia Reis Durte. There, and according to Lusa, the ruler of the neighboring region "expressed concern" for Hong Kong being considered a fiscal paradise since the list was created by the Portuguese authorities in 2004. The inclusion in the list “would subject Hong Kong companies to a tax increase and special measures” in Portugal, described the ruler, who recalled that the two parties signed an agreement to prevent double taxation, which came into force in 2012. In the same meeting, Christopher Hui reminded the Portuguese Secretary of State that the European Union (EU) removed, in February 2024, Raehk from the non -cooperative jurisdictions list for tax purposes, a decision that, in the secretary's understanding, “demonstrated the EU recognition of Hong Kong's efforts” to introduce measures that combat “the [fiscal] fiscal] resulting from the non -non -pair evasion taxation ”. Christopher Hui added that Hong Kong already fulfilled all European standards in this matter. It should be noted that, at the time, the Portuguese Minister of the Economy was Pedro Reis, who at an event about Christopher Hui's visit to Lisbon, said it was important to “maintain sustainable economic growth and take advantage of the opportunities for mutual investment” between Portugal and Hong Kong. Chamber of Commerce Rejubila However, the Portugal-Hong Chamber of Commerce and Industry Kong (PHKCCI, in the English acronym) issued a note in LinkedIn to highlight Hong Kong's exit from this list. "This milestone represents the culmination of a long-term and transverse process in Portugal, which involved continuous dialogue and coordination between successive governments, parliamentary parties and international partners. Although the consensus on the objective was solid, the process has gradually unfolded over more than a decade," he reads. For PHKCCI, the Portuguese State decision “restores coherence with the European Union's rules and reflects Portugal's commitment to a fair and current approach to its tax governance”, also stressing the “importance of respecting objective criteria, maintaining a permanent dialogue and ensuring legal and diplomatic rigor in the management of fiscal policy”. “As a chamber of commerce and industry Portugal-Hong Kong, we greeted this outcome as a step forward in the alignment of our bilateral environment of commerce and investment with predictability, transparency and good governance. We maintain a committed to facilitating constructive involvement between our markets, supporting the clarity in tax staff and fostering mutual confidence”, is referred to in the same note. According to the online newspaper Eco, the inclusion of a country or territory on the list of tax havens happens if there is no tax similar to IRC [tax on the income of legal persons], charged in Portugal, or the existence of tax benefits that are more favorable than in the European country. It also serves as a criterion for inclusion in the list administrative practices of countries or regions do not allow the effective exchange of tax information. All issues that Hong Kong considers to have exceeded and ensure that there is full respect for the fight against fiscal dropout. More concretely, and when his visit to Portugal last year, Secretary Christopher Hui spoke of the “Hong Kong efforts in the introduction of a foreign source performance regime (FSIE) for certain passive income to better combat transionic dropout resulting from the non -taxation”. In his view, "such efforts fully aligned the Hong Kong FSIE regime with FSIE regimes updated by the EU regimes in December 2022". MEXIDES IN FSIE According to an explanatory note from consultant PriceWaterhousecoopers (PWC), Hong Kong was added to the EU Observation list in October 2021. On that date, the EU was concerned that, under the then Foreign Source Exemption Scheme (FSIE), there could be situations in which companies without substantial economic activity in Hong Kong would not be subject to Tax regarding certain passive income from a foreign source (such as interest and royalties), thus resulting in situations of 'double non-tax', ”can be read. The following year, Raehk "promulgated legislative changes", namely in December 2022, to "improve and reinforce the FSIE regime against transfronical fiscal evasion." With the changes in force since 1 January 2023, “the four types of foreign source income”, such as dividends, interest, intellectual property income and alienation gains from the sale of corporate interests, are “being considered origin in Hong Kong and subject to profit tax if received in Hong Kong by an entity of a multinational group that exercises trade, profession or business in the business Territory, ”explains PWC,“ except if this entity meets the requirements of the applicable exception ”. After the EU's suggestion, "the Raehk government further perfected the FSIE regime to widen the scope of the covered incomes, including alienation gains from other types of assets (beyond corporate appearances) in order to align with the latest EU orientation, with effect from 1 January 2024". It was then that on February 20 last year the EU council published the conclusions of the semiannual EU review regarding the “non -cooperative jurisdictions for tax purposes”, the so -called “black list” of tax havens, as well as the “observation list” regarding the “state of cooperation with the EU in relation to the commitments made by cooperative jurisdictions to implement principles of good tax governance”. At that time Hong Kong was taken from the list, considering the EU that the territory had "fulfilled the commitment by changing the FSIE regime", highlighting PWC, in the same note, that Raehk is now "among the jurisdictions that cooperate with the EU and do not have pending commitments." According to PWC, "the Raehk government greeted the recognition of the EU of efforts to align its FSIE regime with the relevant requirements, as reflected in its removal from the EU observation list", and will also have "will continue to comply with international tax standards, while maintaining Hong Kong fiscal competitiveness."

item.title: Elections | Political programs focused on the economy and social support
item.description:
There are six lists of candidates for deputies by Via Direct, and another six by the way indirect. There are new guys, many out of departure and even deputies who decided to wander among suffrage. The main focuses of political programs continue to be employment, the promotion of the economy and the increase in social support
On September 14 will be chosen the deputies of the Legislative Assembly (AL), either by the vote of the people, in the direct via or by indirect way through the associations that represent the various professional sectors. The campaign is on the streets and the 12 lists have made available electoral programs whose content does not differ much from the interpeairs presented to the government in recent years, given that most of the list heads have been in AL for some time. Thus, issues such as the crisis in youth employment, the incentive for local consumption, the need for more social support and the regional integration of Macao in Hengqin and the Great Bay dominate the measures presented. In the case of list 1, the “Association of United Citizens of Macao” has roots in Fujian and is led by Mrs Song Pek Kei, who started very young to accompany businessman Chan Meng Kam in parliamentary Lides. Now he is accompanied by the young deputy Nick Lei, followed in third place, and on a list of ten people, Chan Lai Kei. In the work area, the list defends the creation of a share for residents in all professional areas, “support for employment and local companies”, and the guarantee that “85 percent, or more, of employees are local residents”. It is also advocated the release of “vacancies in the financial and management areas for qualified residents”, as well as the granting of a subsidy of five thousand patacas for “each resident eligible in employment support, unemployed or temporary workers”. The Nova Esperança list, led by José Pereira Coutinho, wants “employment for all” and promises to fight for “Macao's permanent residents priority at game dealers” and the establishment of a “compulsory system (pension fund), which protects 100 percent to the population”. The electoral program also emphasizes the area of ​​game promoters, whose number of licenses has fallen by the last years. The list calls for “reinforcement of its viability by increasing the legal commission from 1.25 to 1.30 percent” and “facilitating the opening of bank accounts for licenses” junket attributed by the executive. In the case of list 3, the Promoting Union for Progress, which represents the General Union of Macao residents' associations, led by Deputy Leong Hong Sai, asks for “improving the use of residents”, tourism revitalization or support for “small and medium enterprises”. List 5, the union for development, is led by a well -known al face. Ella Lei and the workers' bench partner Leong Sun Iok again put their jobs as a political priority. The “guarantee of employment opportunities to local” is asked, as well as the “improvement of the entry and exits system of foreign workers”. The list of workers promises to fight for the development of “paid training to increase the qualifications of local workers”, as well as “improvement of the employment support system, properly increasing the allocation of services”. Also in the work area, this group of candidates asks to be “improved the workers protection system to increase their living”, suggesting the “strengthening of the salary structure” and the “social security system to increase workers' protection level”. Consuming it is necessary Since Macao has recovered from the crisis caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, with the closing of business, which another problem has placed: the fact that it is easier to travel to China has made residents consume less in the territory, affecting the trade in less tourist areas. This has been a recurring theme in the interventions of deputies in AL and is also in the electoral programs. Returning to the list linked to the Fujian community, “incentives for domestic consumption” are asked to “reduce pressure on residents' lives” and “revitalize the local economy”. For this should be followed "the experiences of consumption support programs between 2020 and 2022, creating new consumer cards to stimulate trade." In the case of Pereira Coutinho's list, the institution is defended “an electronic annual support card for the consumption of 10,000 patacas”, and the candidate even calls for the creation of a permanent cash planning plan with the value from 15,000. The workers also ask "the stimulus to consumption in order to help residents spend and boost the economy." In the case of Macao-Guangdong Union 4, representing the Jiangmen Naturals, and led by the academic Joey Lao Chi Ngai, it is asked to “promote the operation of a 'coordination working group for employment promotion, in order to boost the social mobility of residents.” It is also suggested to review “several social security regimes, and investment in resources to support the elderly, children, people with disabilities and vulnerable groups”. Rómulo Santos Joey Lao Consumption is not forgotten With regard to the executive's subsidies to the so -called most vulnerable layers of the population, children, young people, the elderly, chronic patients or disabled people, all lists ask for more. In the case of the group led by Song Pek Kei it is suggested to conduct a study “on the creation of a universal health insurance system to ensure free basic medical services for all residents”. It is also asked for a “better use of resources to expand coverage of medical services and reduce families' burden” in this area. It should be noted that the Executive, in addition to complying with moderating rates for residents, also assigns health valleys worth six thousand patacas for residents. Song Pek Kei's list takes one of Sam Hou Fai's latest measures, the creation of a childhood allowance to ask for its extension from three to six years of the beneficiary. The creation of “differentiated subsidies for the second and third children” is also advocated, as well as a 90-day maternity leave to increase the birth rate. Looking at the New Hope list, the news is the request for conversion “of the current [health] benefits to multifunctional consumption valleys with the value of 10,000 patacas”, as well as the expansion of the maternity leave to 90 days. In the case of childhood subsidy, the New Hope defends its extension up to the child's 12 years and a monthly payment of 2,000 patacas. Also noteworthy is to defend the increase in the allowance to informal caregivers and monoparent families from 5,000 to 8,000 monthly patacas. Given that Coutinho is linked to the Association of Macao Public Function Workers, this is an area that is paid attention to this political program: increase, between 30 and 50 percent, “from the base remuneration, replacing the 100 points of the Indicion Table, to the agents of the security forces”, also defending the “voluntary retirement after 20 years of service”. In the case of list 6, a good home alliance, led by Wong Kit Cheng, the most and better measures are made for parents: “increase the number of parental licenses and monitoring to prenatal exams”, it reads, also the defense of “more flexible working hours and tax deductions by the number of children in charge”. In an overview of the programs, it should be noted that in six lists of direct suffrage, only the new hope list uses the two official, Portuguese and Chinese languages. In the indirect suffrage there are more groups to make this bet, such as the union of the business interests of Macau and the union of the interests of Macao professionals. There are no English programs. These elections are based on the departure of deputies such as Ron Lam U Tou, Chak Mo, Chan Hong and Lei Chan U. What indirects want In the indirect suffrage there is a novelty: the entry of businessman Kevin Ho, nephew of Edmund Ho, to the list led by José Chui Sa Peng, the “Union of Macau Business Interests”, which represents the industrial, commercial and financial sectors. Highlight, in this group, for the entry of Si Ka Lon, which always competed by the way. This group advocates “support for digital and high -tech transformation to modernize traditional industries and develop emerging sectors”, also promising to “listen carefully to the difficulties and claims of commercial and financial industries, especially small and medium -sized companies”. Kevin Ho The union of the interests of Macao professionals, led by Iau Teng Pio, a subdirector of the Faculty of Law of the University of Macao, defends the struggle for the “training of the diversification of the economy in accordance with professional strength” and “the articulation of the rules of Macau and Hengqin”. To this end, it suggests the creation of an “experimental zone of application” of these same norms, exploring “a direct and transfronical execution mechanism of arbitration”. Following is the desire to “strengthen international competitiveness of law”, encouraging “exceptional talents to study in the interior of China”. A face for education Ho Ion Sang, a face that we got used to in direct suffrage, competes again for the indirect suffrage alone, representing the education sector, with the Association of Promotion of Social Service and Education. The candidate calls for the “implementation of mental health support measures” as well as “improving the overall quality of Macao medical services and effectiveness in care”. Ho Ion Sang promises to fight for measures that look “the impact of low birth in the education system” and more “support for inclusive education and special education schools”. The businesswoman Angela Leong joins the first time to MA Chi Seng to compete for the Cultural and Sports Union of Sol Nascente, in defense of culture and sport. One of the ideas is “asking the government to guide the use of the free -related elements [of the concessionaires] to support local cultural and sports activities”. In the “Joint Commission of the Associations of Employees”, led by Deputy Lam Lon Wai, it is defended the improvement of infrastructure, the “reduction of business costs and the facilitation of trade and investment”. The promotion of the “sharing the benefits of economic development with employees” is asked, stabilizing a “salary growth mechanism”. In the union of workers' associations, led by Leong Pou U and Choi Kam Fu, it is suggested “improving the protection of work and workers”, as well as “the protection of the basic rights of workers, improving infrastructure of child support”. The “dynamic adjustment of the minimum wage to ensure basic life needs” is also advocated.

item.title: China | Montenegro expects “close relationship” fruits with Russia
item.description:
The Portuguese Prime Minister said yesterday, in a meeting with President Xi Jinping, who expects the “close relationship” between China and Russia to help reach a peace agreement in Ukraine. Official visit to China, with Macau, Luís Montenegro stressed China's fundamental role in the global context
The Portuguese Prime Minister said yesterday, before the President of the Popular Republic of China, Xi Jinping, who has his close relationship with Russia to “build a fair and lasting peace” in Ukraine. Luís Montenegro made these statements at the beginning of the first day of the official visit to China, during the meeting with Xi Jinping, of which journalists could only record the first three minutes. "I can not help, on behalf of the government of Portugal, to transmit to the President that we count a lot with your contribution and the close relationship that China maintains with the Russian Federation to be able, as fast as possible, build just and lasting peace in Ukraine," he said. Earlier, Montenegro stressed that, in the international context, Portugal and China have maintained "on many occasions a base of cooperation and sharing of values." "China has a key role in the global and international context, a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council and we expect your contribution to build bridges between peoples, bring some of those who are in conflict, promote peace, promote multilateralism, promote respect for human rights," said the Portuguese politician. Montenegro said he was confident that the appeal he addressed to the president of China about the Russian-Ukraine conflict will be heard. "I believe that the appeal, coming from a friendly country, coming from a European Union (EU) country, coming from a country, such as Mr. President XI Jinping also emphasized, who has an identity of values ​​and route, will not fall into a rotor bag," he said. Saying not being able to answer for the president of China, Montenegro expressed convinced that Portugal has done what is required to this conflict. "My conviction is that, to our dimension and without any kind of pretentiousness, we do what is required to a nation with history and the international respectability that Portugal has. We are builders of bridges, we are protagonists of the approach between peoples, we are advocates of peace, defenders of values, respect for people's rights," he said. Montenegro considered that, at the meeting with Xi Jinping, he was limited to “being frank, loyal and direct in the appeal” so that China's ability to influence and “bring practical results” to Ukraine. Luís Montenegro also mentioned that “it is very tasteful” that he makes this official visit to China, after brief statements by Chinese President Xi Jinping. "As Mr. President said, Portugal and China have a relationship founded on a story that has shared with various times in common, but also a relationship facing the future. I remember Mr. President's visit to Portugal for seven years and I also want to convey the greetings of Mr. President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa," he said. Good friends The Portuguese Prime Minister expressed agreement with the words of Xi Jinping about how the transition from the administration of Macao de Portugal to China in 1999 took place. "We had in the transition from Macau a good expression of the way we were able to converge and we managed to ensure the cultural identity and the relationship between the special administrative region of Macau, with Portugal and with China," he said. At yesterday's meeting, Xi Jinping said that “Portugal is a good friend of China”, saying that it is “a pleasure” to meet the Prime Minister, Luís Montenegro. “Welcome on the visit to China. I remember that in 2018 I made a state visit to Portugal, which left me a beautiful impression, and deep,” he said, taking the opportunity to ask Montenegro to transmit to the Portuguese head of state, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, “sincere greetings”, according to the simultaneous translation into Portuguese of his statements. The Chinese president stressed that China and Portugal "are countries with deep history, and the two peoples have idiosyncrasy, openness, inclusion, progress and autonomy", arguing that "Portugal plays an important and unique role on the international stage." Xi Jinping also highlighted “the important role” played by three former Portuguese prime ministers in international and regional affairs. "The Secretary General of the United Nations, António Guterres, the president of the European Council, António Costa, and the former president of the European Commission Durão Barroso. I have good relations with them," he said. In the brief statement, the Chinese president stated that "Portugal is a good friend of China" and considered that both countries have "properly resolved" the issue of Macao through friendly negotiations. " "Portugal was also the first country in Western Europe to sign with China acts of cooperation under the initiative" a track, a route ", and the first country in the euro zone that issued titles" in the Chinese currency, he said. A little help in the crisis In turn, Luís Montenegro thanked China for the support of Portugal during the period of the financial crisis. "At the level of our bilateral economic cooperation, it is my duty to tell you that we do not forget, on the contrary, we have very well present and respect the bet that China has developed in the Portuguese economy, in one of the most critical moments of our country, when the financial crisis," he said. As had been highlighted moments earlier by the President of the Popular Republic of China, Montenegro also considered that, in recent years, the two countries have reinforced ties "in various sectors of the economy, from energy to bank, from health to water supply." "Our conviction is that we can continue to walk this path on the basis of trust," said the prime minister. Luís Montenegro landed in Beijing early Monday afternoon, closed to the media, and did not have any public agenda that day. The prime minister's official agenda began yesterday morning with a ceremony of deposition of a wreath at the monument to the people of the people, in Tiananmen Square, where he was accompanied by his wife and three ministers who are part of this visit: Paulo Rangel, Minister of State and Foreign Affairs, Manuel Castro Almeida, Minister of Economics and Territorial Cohesion, and Graça Carvalho, Minister of Environment and Energy. In addition to the meeting with Xi Jinping, Luís Montenegro met first with the president of the China National Popular Assembly, Zhao Leji. In the late afternoon, the head of the Portuguese government had a work of work with the Chinese counterpart, I read Qiang, also at the Great Palace of the People, having followed to Macao, where he has today schedule only in the morning. Tomorrow and Friday, Montenegro will make an official visit to Japan, with tickets for Tokyo and Osaka. Pilfe At HM, analyst Tiago André Lopes, an auxiliary professor responsible for Asia Study at Lusíada do Porto University, argued that “Lisbon and Beijing share quite different views regarding international conflicts”. It should be noted that Montenegro visits China when they spend a few days about the summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, which took place in the Chinese town of Tianjin, and where conflicts were discussed Gaza or Russia-Ucrania. "We can see that Lisbon is distinctive in the Palestinian issue, looking little uncomfortable with the barbarism that is slaughtered over the Palestinians; while China positions itself in a different spectrum from Portugal in the Ukraine War. What does this tell us? The trip will be very focused on the dimension of economic diplomacy and much less in the so -called traditional diplomacy," said the analyst. Tiago André Lopes considers that Portugal could take advantage of this trip through Asia "to self-admit some of the dependence on the Brussels-Washington axis and gain space for maneuver by integrating Beijing's Force," although "the current government bets on an atlanticism-Europeist without global ambitions." Asked about the issue of 5G, which guided the Portugal-China relationship in recent months, Tiago André Lopes understands that Montenegro's trip to Beijing serves to "minimize the impact" of this issue and "try to leverage economic cooperation between the two countries." "An element that can help measure the pulse of the Portuguese Prime Minister's visit will be the signing of documents. Will be signed memorandum of understanding (which are generally not binding), or commercial agreements? Or only press notes? This will be the best barometer, beyond the words of circumstance that will naturally be delivered," he said. Investments | Montenegro says Portugal is “reliable and confident” Luís Montenegro said yesterday that during the official visit to China and then Japan, he wants to bring the message that Portugal “is a reliable and confident country” for economic investments. According to the Prime Minister, the program “Gives the opportunity that the Portuguese Prime Minister has to talk and interact directly with the President of the National Assembly of the Popular Republic of China, with the President of the Republic, with the Prime Minister”. "At the same time that the Minister of State and Foreign Affairs, the Minister of Economy and the Minister of Environment and Energy interact bilaterally with their counterparts and also with entrepreneurs and Chinese companies that operate in Portugal and with Portuguese companies operating in China," he added. For Montenegro, the fact that the visits are being made “with some compression in terms of durability” - four days divided between China and Japan - should be seen from another perspective. "It is just the record that we are able to do all this simultaneously, we are able to leave here to Macau, we are able to go to Tokyo and to be able, in this geographical area, to bring the message that Portugal is a confident country, is a reliable country, it is a country where it is worth looking and that also looks to the world," he defended. Montenegro also pointed out that Portugal is already “enjoying several investments that originate in China and have been levers for the transformation and economic development of Portugal”. "It is our intention to contribute to our coming here so that we can also open doors to which more Portuguese companies can find in the Chinese market the destination of their products and, therefore, also increase our export share for this geography," he said. A.S.S. / Portuguese

item.title: Tuffons / Security | DSAL APPEALS TO THE GOOD FIELD OF COMPANIES
item.description:
To prevent workers from being prevented from returning home due to typhoons, the government is committed to encouraging companies to wake up working conditions to make employees easier. The lack of regulation was raised by Ron Lam, who recalled that the emission of signal 10 this year kept the casinos open
Last July 20, Typhoon Whipa forced Macao's authorities to issue the Tropical Storm Sign 10 Hort after the sudden form was lifted as the warnings followed, without warning, and the closure of bridges and borders caused many casin workers to retrieve, without form of returning home. This situation was raised by Ron Lam, in one of the last written interpeairs he submitted to the government. Yesterday was released the government response, signed by the director of services for traffic affairs, Chiang NGOC Vai. The deputy deputy of these elections recalled that in the past, after the deadly Tuffon Hato, the government had the casinos ended in case of super tufts, as happened with Typhoon Mangkhut and, in 2023 with Saola. However, this year during the passage of Typhoon Whip, which reached sign 10, the casinos remained open. It is recalled that in the aftermath, the Chui Executive Sai On was widely criticized by short warnings regarding the severity of the storm, with trade and casinos operating normally. As such, Ron Lam asked the government the criteria for ordering the closure of casinos, the most employed industry pillar in the territory. The government did not respond and merely cited the law that determines the suspension of the functioning of the casinos and to refer to the existence of communication channels to adjust measures to the “real situation”, to safeguard the safety of workers and customers of the casinos. Employer harmony Between Sunday and Monday, Macau was 18 hours under the sign of sign 8 of Typhoon, without interruption in the operations of the casinos. In fact, the Government, through the Game Inspection and Coordination Directorate, coordinated with the game dealers plans to provide “appropriate rest areas for workers and customers on site, providing meals and other necessary support, paying full attention to workers and clients in the enclosures”. Regarding the general rules for safeguarding workers' safety and the operation of companies, the government emphasizes that the management of services for labor affairs (DSAL) has prepared “work guidelines in typhoon situations and sudden public incidents” that are not binding. In response to Ron Lam, it is indicated that DSal appeals to employers and workers to negotiate work programming in typhoon cases. In addition, it is stated that Dsal encourages “employers to wake working conditions with workers, according to the rules of good faith, in periods of bad atmospheric conditions, as well as to resolve the real difficulties encountered by the parties through understanding and concertation”. As usual, authorities do not take into account the inequality of power in labor relations, and appeal to the maintenance of “harmonious labor relations”.

item.title: Visit | Chamber of Commerce asks for use of commercial tensions
item.description:
Integrated in the entourage of Luís Montenegro to China, Japan and Macau, Bernardo Mendia, Mayor of Commerce and Luso-Chinese industry, argues that Portugal should take advantage of current commercial tensions to attract more Chinese investment, taking advantage of Macao as platform
Commercial tensions between Europe, the United States of America (US) and China open a window of opportunity for Portugal to attract Chinese industrial investment, yesterday defended the mayor of Luso-Chinese commerce and industry, Bernardo Mendia. Speaking to the Lusa Agency, on the sidelines of the visit of Portuguese Prime Minister Luís Montenegro, to the country, Mendia highlighted several areas in which Chinese companies are competitive and coincide with European priorities, such as the energy transition. "Renewable energies, electric vehicles, batteries, energy storage, 5G -associated technologies and artificial intelligence are areas where Portugal should give their hands and enjoy the fact that we have Macau as a bridge," he said. The European Commission has imposed rates of up to 35 percent on Chinese electric car manufacturers, to avoid unfair competition in the face of subsidies attributed by the Chinese state. This created an incentive to move production to Europe. Chinese manufacturer Byd predicts inaugurating a new factory in southern Hungary, in an investment valued at 4 billion euros. China also accumulates more than 10 billion euros in investments in Spain, in the areas of electric vehicles and green energy. Calb (China Aviation Lithium Battery), one of the largest Chinese batteries manufacturers, confirmed last February an investment of two billion euros in Portugal, to build a Lithium -Lithium Battery Factory in Sines, under the European expansion strategy. Referring to Calb's investment, he considered that this is the type of project that "must be multiplied." "We have to remember, in this visit, the advantages of Portugal to welcome this type of investment. Not only attracts capital, but generates qualified employment, new tax revenues and future exports," he said. The competition Bernardo Meia recalled that Portugal has even attracted a lot of Chinese investment in previous years, but that competition has increased, namely Spain and Hungary, and that "it takes more." The trade war between Beijing and Washington threatens to penalize the Chinese production of almost all products exported to the US, encouraging Chinese manufacturers to move production to circumvent rates, currently fixed at 30 percent, as a result of temporary truce between both sides. "It is a way to circumvent these barriers, but also to generate goodwill and lasting relationships, as Europe has done when it has shifted production to China 20 or 30 years ago," he said. It was warned, however, that it must be aware of the different scales between the two countries. "Portugal does not have the same industrial capacity installed. For every 140 Chinese companies that invest in Portugal, we, to be proportional, would have one," he said. During the stay in China, the Luso-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry participates in various fairs and forums, such as China International Fair for Trade In Services (Cifts) and the Hong Kong Strip and Route initiative. "We want to show that Portugal is open to collaboration and convey concrete opportunities. Sometimes they result in contacts with companies, sometimes with local Chinese governments that also seek foreign investment for their municipalities," he said. "What the Chinese look for is viability. And our mission is to introduce Portugal as a stable and open alternative, at a time when commercial tension and protectionism are growing," he concluded. Bernardo meant considered that Montenegro's visit "is always very positive", stressing that "there was no visit of this level since 2016". "The presence of the prime minister has a lot of weight, especially on the Chinese side. Portugal has this tradition of good relationships with various cultures and this trip, which also includes Macau and Japan, reflects it," he said.

item.title: QingMao | More than 100 million crossings in four years
item.description: In four years, Qingmao's border was used for over 100 million Macao border crossings and the interior. The number was pointed out by the newspaper or Mun, since yesterday was celebrated the fourth anniversary of the opening of the pedestrian border, which can only be crossed by people with Chinese nationality. According to the same data, this border has been registering an annual growth of more than 80 percent. For the quantity of the number, the fact that the border began to function at a time when the Covid-19 pandemic was lived, with major displacement restrictions, including quarantine compliance when cases were registered in Macau or on the other side of the border. The border is open 24 hours a day and the crossing can be done through the automatic gates. However, according to the newspaper or Mun, Macao and Interior authorities are currently considering installing a single machine system, with the same equipment to be used to register the exit of one territory and at the same time entry into the other. Currently, this process is separated in two moments, with the need to use equipment to register the output and another to mark the entry.

item.title: Fine unconsciousness (i)
item.description: Last August 15, the emergency management office of the new Dapeng district, Shenzhen, in mainland China, instructed Nan'ao's office to implement a fine based on the “regulations on the establishment of the first natural disasters prevention decree in Shenzhen Dapeng, China”. It was a measure taken for the first time in the mainland China under these regulations. The media reported that the 19th of July, two tourists visiting Shenzhen, in mainland China, ignored the Typhoon warning and entered a dangerous area during a blue alert issued by the meteorology office at the time of Wipha's passage. At that moment, they asked the police for help. They had entered the rail at 10.30 h and called the authorities at 20.00, when the Typhoon Yellow Alert had already been raised. After receiving the request for help, the rescue and fire fighting brigade from the new Dapeng district and the Fire Fighting Brigade in the Nan'ao Forest led the rescue operations at night, having been able to locate the two men at 2.30 pm the next day. However, the typhoon continued to approach, forcing the teams to remain on the mountain. Finally they returned to the rail around 7.40 h, when the typhoon sign had already increased to orange, approximately 12 hours after the warning was issued. The two men claimed to be outdoor hiking enthusiasts. They only had lanterns and groceries and had no power bank. When they called the police, the mobile phones had only 5 percent battery. Subsequently, Nan'ao's office fined them under the “Regulation for the Prevention and Control of Natural Disasters in Shenzhen Special Economic Zone,” forcing each to pay 5,000 RMB. This was the first time in China that someone was fined under a regulation to prevent natural disasters. The regulation, which entered into force on November 1, 2023, indicates the areas with the potential for the occurrence of natural disasters, which may endanger lives or goods under certain circumstances and imposes restrictions on entries. Transgressors are subject to fines between 5,000 and 20,000 RMB and should cover the costs of rescue operations. In Macau there are similar situations. This year, during the passage of Typhoon Wipha, two tourists were strolling at the Governador Carvalho Bridge. After a resident warned, the judicial police arrived quickly and withdrew the two men. Subsequently, they were fined under the traffic regulation because they ignored the “sign of prohibition to cross the bridge”. In Hong Kong, there is the law of natural parks. Although explicitly prohibits the entrances during the Tapfan passage, the Department of Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation, for safety reasons, will issue the “walking safety guidelines” and will close some recreational areas. These measures aim to prohibit residents from entering the natural parks during the passage of typhoons, and penalizing transgressors with fines and eventually with a penalty up to 14 days in prison. These legislations share a guiding thread: the penalty of those who enter delimited and signaled areas with the warning “no entry is not allowed.” However, there is no legislation to regulate the practice of dangerous activities during natural disasters, such as pursuit of typhoons and surfing. We will continue our analysis next week, which will focus on the regulation of these risk activities. item.title: Comic Band | Association “We are!” launches competition for residents
item.description:
The “Somos! - Portuguese Language Communication Association” launches in October a visual arts competition, more specifically comic books, thinking of an audience of young people aged between 15 and 25 years. Free-themed jobs are expected, also with a Wesley Chan workshop, president of Hyper Comic Society, and local cartoonist Rodrigo de Matos
A competition for visual arts lovers is almost emerging and they use this artistic form to express their vision. This is the “BD-Macau” contest, promoted by “Somos!-Portuguese Language Communication Association” (Somos-ACLP), which will be launched in October. This is a competition directed to a young local audience, which is intended, according to a note from the Association, to “encourage the creation of original comic band” over the territory. In the one that will be the first edition of this contest, which is intended to be bi-anual, the theme is free. The event will be preceded by a workshop directed by local Cartoonist Rodrigo de Matos, a usual name of editorial cartoons published in the Ponto Final newspaper and also in the Portuguese Express weekly, as well as Welsey Chan, president of Hyper Comic Society, which promise to highlight all secrets and masters to draw a good cartoon or comics. The registration period runs until October 5, and the final work shall be submitted from October 12 to November 30. Participants have to be residents of Macao, aged 15 to 25 years. Each work must have at least four boards, using the narration by images and the typical language of the comic. Macao's sociocultural specificities should be highlighted, with the action of the “stories to the squares” to unfold in the city, illustrating their urban landscape. In case of incorporation of text, it must be written in one of the official languages, the Chinese or Portuguese. Original works made earlier, as long as they have never been awarded, may be submitted to contest. The workshop will take place on October 11, hoping that participants will “learn or consolidate the basic techniques of design and character creation, as well as narrative development for this literary genre”. A debut Not being the first contest of “Somos!”, Which has already presented initiatives in the area of ​​photography or drawing, with a connection to the world of Lusophony, this is the first time that a contest has been presented with BD. With this project, the association aims to support creative development in the area of ​​drawing and illustration and boost the emergence of more local works in this artistic expression, is referred to in the same note. The jury will choose the big winner and the second and third classifieds, and their 7000, 4000 and 2000 patacas are attributed respectively respectively. In addition, a possible book edition of some of the bands drawn to the contest can be considered, through a prior qualitative assessment by the jury and Somos - ACLP. The association thus aims to contribute to the increase of books produced and edited in Macao, as well as to the imagery and written registration of the progress of the city and its mutations. With the organization of the visual art competition: “BD-Macau”, Somos-ACLP intends to celebrate Macau and its architectural and historical richness, as a place of cultural confluence and sino-illusophone basis. Entries must be made through the Electronic Page of Somos - ACLP.

item.title: “Macao Art” | New exhibitions to see from the end of the month
item.description:
For several months that “Macao Art - Macau International Art Biennial 2025” wanders through the territory, but is far from coming to an end. From the 24th of this month, three more projects will be inaugurated: “Hands borrowed”, “goods and warriors” and “non -terminal”. The first is at the D. Pedro V Theater, the rest lead to reflections and interactions between Rua da Tercena and Macau Centro Square
In September there is still time and space to enjoy the new exhibitions that “Art Macau - International Art Biennial of Macau 2025” brings to the territory. From the 24th onwards, three projects integrated in the “Exhibition of Public Art”, subordinate to the theme “Waves and Paths”, are presented to the public. These are five pieces or sets of works by nine artists, entitled “Hands borrowed”, “goods and warriors” and “non-terminal”. In addition, also on September 24, between 19h and 8:30 pm, the “Conversation and Dialogue: The Public Nature of Public Art” colloquium in the Auditorium of the Macao Art Museum, which features Wu Wei, co-curator of the Biennial, and artists Ann Hamilton, Yin Xiuzhen, Jason Ho and Assemblis Gang. The lecture will focus on “on ways of cultivating a new, dynamic and vibrant approach in the context of 'face -to -face' public art”. Registration takes place until September 19th on the Macao Single Account platform. Ann Hamilton, an American artist, is the name behind one of the new projects on display, “Hands borrowed”, patent at the D. Pedro V Theater. This artist is, according to a note from the Cultural Institute (IC), “internationally recognized for its large-scale multimedia facilities, public projects and their performance collaborations”. In Macao the artist recreates “The Historical Memory of Sino-West Trade with Multimedia Art”. Interactive paths Another of the artists participating in the Colloquium, Yin Xiuzhen, is considered a “renowned Chinese contemporary artist”. It presents in Macao the “non -terminal”, an interactive video installation patent in the square of the Cultural Center of Macau (CCM). This installation, which can be seen until December 12, focuses on a “static luggage treadmill” made of metal, wood and rubber, forming an interactive platform, where the public can rest, move and socialize. Through the treadmill, there are plastic rugs where the audience can run, skateboard and bike. The nine screens hanging above the installation display live images of the place and scenes of pre-recorded life, and the audience can also send their own videos to create a lively theater of life together. “This work transforms cultural spaces and artistic scenes into an experimental field for social behavior, highlighting the idea that the journey of life and art has no end and suggesting the fluidity of life, memory and identity,” describes the IC. THE ROLE OF AGRICULTURE Finally, the British Interdisciplinary Assembly Collective, known for revitalizing urban spaces through community and creative design, presents “goods and warriors”, a project that “serves to reflect on the relationship between land and people”. Available at Number 19 of Tercena Street in Macao, this project “examines the current developments of small -scale agriculture in China and the UK, using video facilities and micronarrative techniques to directly present scenes of daily life and work in small farms in both regions”. Thus, it is exploited “the symbiotic relationship between earth and humanity through the display of documents and the holding of public events, thus creating an emotional connection between Earth and the public of Macao”, describes the IC. With “goods and warriors”, it presents a “upward perspective” of the connection of agriculture with people and the “unique value of the small-scale agricultural economy for ecological balance, community resilience and economic stability, challenging the preconceived idea of ​​'urban centrism' and also re-examining the construction role of rural practices in the construction of a sustainable future”. “Goods and Warriors” is also available for public visit until December 12 this year, aiming to “establish a link between land, food and human senses and develop a new dialogue between the urban audience and the agricultural landscapes that nourish it, at the same time offering a visual validation for the cultural value and the survival wisdom necessary for future urban development in the growing uncertain uncertainties of globalization”.

item.title: FINAM | Cuca Roseta acts next to the Chinese orchestra of Macau
item.description:
This year's Macao International Music Festival poster brings Portuguese fadista Cuca Roseta, who goes on stage next to the Macao Chinese Orchestra, in a fusion of sounds that is no longer new to Macao. Also highlight for the opera “Carmen”, by French Georges Bizet
The Macao International Music Festival (FINAM) has, for the third consecutive edition, with a fadista. This time, the elected is Cuca Roseta that will act accompanied by the Chinese orchestra of Macao (OCM), like Mariza in 2024, the organization announced on Friday. The Macao Cultural Center (CCM) hosts, on October 11, the 43 -year -old Lisbon, described in a statement as a “Portuguese fado diva” by the Cultural Institute (IC), which organizes the festival. The FINAM program underlines that the concert “materializes a cultural exchange”, between OCM's “rich cultural heritage” and the “jazz, bossa nova influences and songs of the world” in the style of Cuca Roseta. The end returned to the stage in 2022, after a two -year interregnum due to the pandemic, with a program that included two shows of foreign guests, one of which from Portuguese António Zambujo, but only through recorded performances. The return of foreign artists took place in 2023, after the end of restrictions on entry into the region, in a program that included a Gisela João concert. Last year, it was Mariza's turn with OCM. The orchestra was also created during the Portuguese administration of Macao in 1987 - the year also the first edition of Fimm - and uses traditional Chinese instruments. item.title: TAPAH | Authorities deny the connection between elderly injury and gaffe
item.description:
Authorities refuse that Leong Man Cheong's statements, who inadvertently asked people to go to the street during the Typhoon passage, led to an elderly woman's injury. According to SPU and COPC there is no temporal coincidence between events. Following the denial was arrested a resident
Unit Police Services (SPU) and the Civil Protection Operation Center (COPC) refuse to have any link between a woman who broke the leg and the Leong Man Cheong gaffe during the Tapah typhoon. As a result, the authorities yesterday detained a resident, which is being held responsible for the rumor. On Monday, while talking to the population about the typhoon, the SPU general commander was wrong and appealed to the population to avoid staying at home or in interior and safe spaces. The information was eventually corrected moments later by Kam Chit Soi, the SPU commissioner, with the COPC appealing to the population to stay home, in interior and safe spaces. However, the error became viral, generated several online games and led to circulating a video in social networks in which a man, the alleged son of the wife, accused the wrong information of having made his parent had gone to the street. The author of the video also stated that the 80 -year -old mother had fallen into some stairs due to slippery floor, and had hit six other people. In the video, the man never proved, it was only possible to see an alleged mobile phone call to the Civil Protection Operation Center with complaints about incorrect information. In the answer, the center guaranteed that the opinion was going to be sent to the superiors to “be accompanied”. All fake With the video becoming viral, the SPU and COPC issued a statement to deny the situation and appealed to the population to “maintain a healthy environment” on social networks. According to the official information, after the allegations transmitted in the video, “an immediate investigation” was carried out. "After investigation, the time when the elderly woman was injured and the subsequent call to ask for help happened half an hour before the transmission of this center. There is no temporal overlap between the two events," they said. “Therefore, the elderly injuries were by no means caused by the transmission of this center,” he was added. “Of course, we express our profound concern for the elderly wound and wish you a quick recovery,” was stressed. In the statement, the authorities again apologized for the error, but did not fail to criticize the online environment. “We reiterate our sincere excuses for the misunderstanding caused by our employee's verbal lapse and we will take action to prevent similar situations from occurring,” he was promised. "We also regret the unfounded accusations that circulate online and urge the public to discern the truth, working together to maintain a healthy and rational online environment," he was added. Detained resident Yesterday afternoon, and after the first denial, the Judiciary Police announced the detention of a local resident, about 50, related to the case. From the CPSP perspective, the man's performance “seriously damaged the image and credibility of the Government of Masters”, with the detainee to invent a connection between Leong Man Cheong's appeal and the elderly injury. The detainee is indicted of a crime related to the violation of the law to combat computer crime, which was not specified by the newspaper or Mun, when it revealed the detention, of a crime of offense to the legal person who exercises public authority and the crime of advertising and slander. When questioned by the authorities, the man admitted to being the author of the video, but argued that he was confused at the time of his mother's accident and at the time of Leong Man Cheong's error, which led to the controversy's video. The case was referred to the prosecutor.

item.title: Cyclone | Tapah Paralisa Macau, without schools, public services and transportation
item.description:
Tapah tropical cyclone forced 18 hours of signal 8 and immediate prevention state, completely paralyzing the city. Despite the few damage, classes and public services were suspended throughout the day, and four injured were recorded. This was the ninth tropical cyclone to affect Macau this year, a total that has not been seen for over 30 years
About 20 minutes after the emission of Storm signal 8, due to the passage of the Tapah Tropical Cyclone by Macao, the direction of Youth Education and Development Services indicated that children's, primary, secondary and special teachings would be suspended yesterday. About 25 minutes earlier, the Civil Protection Operations Center declared the immediate prevention state, in anticipation of the arrival of Signal 8 of Tropical Storm issued at 9 pm on Sunday, which was only raised yesterday at 3 pm. Also signal 8 would remain raised for 18 hours, completely paralyzing Macao in this week's start. Tapah was the ninth tropical cyclone to pass through Macau this year. The last time nine tropical storms affected the territory in the same year was in 1993. Late yesterday morning, administration and civil service services announced that “public administration services and entities are closed in the afternoon and their services are suspended” due to the maintenance of signal 8 until 3 pm yesterday. However, as it is natural, the Public Security Police Corps, the Fire Department, the Judiciary Police, Customs Services and the Emergency Services of the Conde de São Januário Hospital Center (including the islands urgent post) continued to provide emergency services to citizens. Following the example of MSAR Public Administration services, the Portuguese Consulate General in Macao and Hong Kong ended the public service services yesterday throughout the day. "We will come into contact with all users to reschedule the calls, so that if possible all are marked by the end of this week," was added in a publication on the Consulate's Facebook page, which also appealed to the Portuguese Macao and Hong Kong communities, to follow the "recommendations of the authorities about the care to be observed while alert signs are issued." Between one point and another Public transport was also severely affected by the Tapah cyclone, with the authorities decreing the suspension of circulation, which was only raised after 3 pm yesterday, with the reduction of the alert to signal 3. Prior to the restart of public transport circulation, customs services launched an appeal to residents, tourists and workers "to enter Macao in a phase, collaborate with the instructions of the border post staff and use the means of public transport in an orderly manner." Despite the appeal, as soon as the buses began to circulate, long lines were formed in stops at the busiest points, such as Ferreira do Amaral Square and Barra da Barra. From the moment the gradual standardization of traffic took place, the authorities reopened the four bridges that connect Macau to the mud. With the entry into force of signal 3, public buses resumed the operation, the light meter circular again, as well as the special taxis and the buses between the Macao border post and Hong Kong International Airport. Turbojet ferries resumed the ligaures between Macau and Hong Kong at 2:30 pm (Sheung Wan's departure) and 16h (Macao's departure). Between Sunday and 2 pm yesterday, 81 flights were canceled at Macao International Airport. According to information conveyed by the civil aviation authority, of this total, 47 were scheduled for yesterday. In addition, 29 flights were delays and nine had time changed. With the storm signal 8, Macao International Airport coordinated with airlines the resuming phased of air operations. In Hong Kong, about a hundred flights were suspended yesterday at the international airport. Cause and Effect In addition to the paralysis of services and transport that Tapah voted Macau during yesterday, the effects of the tropical cyclone led to the record of 25 occurrences, until 2 pm yesterday, at the Center for Civil Protection Operations. Authorities were called for 11 cases of construction/lamp/tree removal at risk of falling and 13 cases of plaster removal, claim, window, awning or other objects at risk of falling or already fallen. In addition, there was a request from a person withheld in a elevator. In the aftermath of operations late yesterday afternoon, Secretary for Security, Wong Sio Chak, revealed four injured due to the tropical cyclone, three of which light and one that forced hospitalization due to a bone fracture. Until 14h, with the reduction of the storm warning on the horizon, 13 people had appealed to the emergency reception centers since they opened doors. Between 07h and 08h in the morning, some areas of the inner port and mud were affected by slight floods, which led some stores not to open and protect entry with full protection bars, but in other shops and restaurants the operations took place without changes. At about 8 am yesterday, the tropical cyclone was at the closest point of Macau, about 110 kilometers, as it moved calmly, about 20 kilometers per hour to the city of Taishan, from Guangdong province, progressively moving away from the territory. Also the wind was gradually weakening. However, Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) warned of the possibility of strong, thunder and wind with strong gusts due to the influence of Tapah's external rainfall. This influence led the authorities to issue the Blue Storm Warning at 10am, the lowest of flood notices, which predicts the water level above the lower half pavement. Still, "the astronomical tide in combination with Storm comes up, raised the water level about 1 meter maximum height and the registered tide was 3.7 meters." In the summary of the SMG, it was indicated that Tapah was a challenge in predictability due to its "small circulation, winding trajectory and proximity to Macau". Regarding the state of time in the coming days, SMGs predicted yesterday the continuation of instability this morning with sometimes strong and thunder, due to the influence of rain bands associated with the cyclone. Sywhellars and thunderstorms should continue tomorrow, with the sun to return to the skies of Macao from Wednesday and staying during the weekend. Operations Center Two hours before signal 8, the Chief Executive chaired a meeting at the Civil Protection Operations Center (COPC), to be aware of preparations to respond to the Tapah tropical cyclone, and the reaction plans of the various departments and institutions. According to the Social Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai "required early consideration and planning of the restoration work of the normality of the post-tuff city, in order to avoid any influence on the displacements of the population to services and schools." "The chief executive also said that due to the successive passage of tropical cyclones through Macao, in recent months, the structure of civil protection has maintained his warning continuously and has done numerous preparation works of immediate reaction against storms," ​​which is why he thanked constant commitment and work. The ruler called for special attention to the response to flooding by monitoring the low zones, ensuring the normal functioning of drainage systems and preparing evacuation plans if the conditions on the ground for this require. Situation that did not occur. In addition, it required that the uninterrupted supply of water and electricity were ensured. Macau Bridge | Completed circulation tests during signal 8 On Sunday night, while Typhoon's sign 8 was lifted, vehicle circulation tests were performed on the Macao Bridge to collect data on traffic conditions in various scenarios for a comprehensive analysis and evaluation, yesterday indicated services for traffic and public works, in a joint statement. The tests included multiple circulations in different lanes, to determine knowledge that allow safety circulation during periods with adverse weather conditions in the new bridge, namely the Typhoon signal 8. Authorities are processing the information, “the analysis and evaluation of the implementation details of the circulation plan that will define the rules and restrictions on traffic on the Macau bridge during storms. Live The Commander General of Unit Police Services (SPU), Leong Man Cheong, was yesterday protagonist of the gaffe of the day, motivating the sharing of humorous publications on social networks. Addressing to the population to appeal to a preventive stance against the passage of the Tapah tropical cyclone to Macau, Leong Man Cheong stated the opposite of what he wanted to convey. "The Civil Protection Operations Center appeals to residents and tourists who, during the eight sign of typhoon, please avoid as much as possible at home, or in interior and safe spaces." Later, SPU's commissioner, Kam Chit Soi, said his colleague had a lapse during the live broadcast and apologized, correcting the Civil Protection Operations Center and appealing to the population to stay at home or shelter in interior and insurance spaces.

Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad for us, in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J.
